page.title: 03Gargrave, Farming.
page.content: About half the farms in the area are owned by the farmers, and half are rented. Nobody grows anything but {grass }There are{Cattle dealers}but most of the farms are{dairy farms.}The milk goes either to a dairy, or local milk rounds . Many local people prefer {Green Top Milk }and are opposed to thoughts that it should be outlawed. The farmers own between 50 and 200 cows each, and cows give up to 35 litres of milk a day. Most farms have a bull. A few{beef cattle}are kept on each farm, and between them the farmers have about 1,000{sheep.} Not many farmers employ workers, but some of them have their sons working with them. { {Gargrave}Agricultural & Horticultural Society's{Show}in late August is a highlight of the farmers year.
